words.ENTRY:
backadverb1.in or to a place or state that somebody/
something was in before: Bye! I'll be back around 6 o'clock. (= back home again)When is Joe coming back from Australia?Go back to sleep.Can I have my pen back, please?2.away from the direction you are facing or moving in: She walked away without looking back.Could everyone move back a little, please?

<H>backpack</H><audio>backpack.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a bag that you use for carrying things on your back. You often use a backpack when you are walking, camping, going to school, etc.</D>

badadjective(worse; worst) 1.not good or pleasant: The weather forecast for tomorrow is bad.I'm in a bad mood today.2.severe or serious: The traffic was really bad on the way to work.She went home with a bad headache.a bad mistake3.of poor quality; of a low standard: Many accidents are caused by bad driving.The company's problems are the result of bad management.4.bad (at something/at doing something) not able to do something well or easily; not skillful or reliable: a bad teacher/driver/cookI've always been bad at sports.5.(not before a noun) bad for somebody/something likely to damage or hurt somebody/something: Smoking's bad for you. not bad; not too bad (informal) fairly good: "How was your vacation?" "Not bad."

<H>bank</H><audio>bank.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>an organization that keeps money safely for its customers; the office or building of such an organization. You can take money out, save, borrow, or exchange money at a bank:</D> <X>Is there a bank near here? I need to cash some traveler's checks.</X>

<H>bar</H><audio>bar.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><NR>1.</NR><D>a place where you can buy and drink (especially alcoholic) drinks:</D> <X>We had a drink in the bar before our meal.</X><NR>2.</NR><D>a small restaurant that serves drinks or light meals:</D> <X>a snack bar</X>

baseballnoun1.uncountablea team game in which players hit a ball with a bat and run around four points (bases) on a field. They have to touch all four bases in order to score a point (run). 2.countablethe hard round ball that is used in this game

<H>basically</H><audio>basically.mp3</audio><PS>adverb</PS><D>looking at what is most important or basic in a person or an object or in a particular situation:</D> <X>She seems to me to be basically a very nice person.</X><dot><X>The design of the new car is basically the same as the old one.</X><dot><X>Basically, all I want is to be left alone.</X>

basketballnoun1.uncountablea game for two teams of five players. There is a net (basket) hanging from a metal ring high up at each end of the court and the players try to throw a ball through the other team's net in order to score points (baskets). 2.countablethe large round ball that is used in this game

be1verb (present I am, you/we/they are, he/she/it is; past I/he/she/it was, you/we/they were; past participle been; present participle being; affirmative short forms 'm, 're, 's; negative short forms aren't, isn't, wasn't, weren't) 1.(used with there to say that somebody/something exists or is in a particular place): Is there life after death?There are some people outside.There are a lot of trees in our yard.2.(used when you are naming people or things, describing them or giving more information about them): That's Jane over there.I'm Alan.Sue is 18. She's in college.He's a doctor.What's that?Where are the scissors?"What color is your car?" "It's green."It's 6 o'clock.How much was your ticket?The show was excellent.be2auxiliary verb1.(used to form the continuous tense of verbs): You're sitting on my book.Is he coming?2.(used to form the passive): This cheese is made in Wisconsin.
<H>beach</H><audio>beach.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>the piece of sandy or rocky land next to the ocean:</D> <X>a nice sandy beach</X><dot><X>to lie on the beach</X>

beautifuladjectiveattractive; giving pleasure to the senses: The view from the top of the hill was really beautiful.What a beautiful day! The weather's perfect!He has a beautiful voice.
a beautiful woman

<H>beauty</H><audio>beauty.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>uncountable</bracket><D>the quality that gives pleasure to the senses; the state of being beautiful:</D> <X>the beauty of Victoria's coast</X><dot><X>Brahms wrote music of great beauty.</X>

<H>beauty school</H><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a school that teaches the use of products and techniques to improve personal beauty; a school that trains people to be hairdressers, beauticians, etc.</D>
<H>because</H><audio>because.mp3</audio><PS>conjunction</PS><D>for the reason that:</D> <X>They didn't go for a walk because it was raining.</X>
becomeverb(past became; past participle become) to begin to be something: She became president of the company in 2003.Jo wants to become a pilot.They became friends.
<H>beef</H><audio>beef.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>uncountable</bracket><D>the meat of a cow:</D> <X>a slice of roast beef</X><dot><X>ground beef</X>
<H>beet</H><audio>beet.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a plant with a dark red root that is cooked and eaten as a vegetable</D>

<H>below</H><su>1</su><audio>below.mp3</audio><PS>adverb</PS><D>at or to a lower position or level:</D> <X>For further explanation of this point, please see below.</X> (= a later part of the book, etc.) <H>below</H><su>2</su><audio>below.mp3</audio><PS>preposition</PS><D>at or to a lower position or level than somebody/something:</D> <X>Do not write below this line.</X><dot><X>It hurts here: just below my knee.</X><dot><X>The temperature fell below freezing.</X>

<H>between</H><audio>between.mp3</audio><PS>preposition</PS><NR>1.</NR><D>in the space that separates two things, people, etc.; somewhere in the middle:</D> <X>I was sitting between Anne and Derek.</X><dot><X>a town between Los Angeles and San Diego</X><NR>2.</NR><D>from one place to another and back again:</D> <X>There aren't any direct flights between here and Toronto.</X><dot><X>the trip between home and the office</X><NR>3.</NR><D>involving or linking two people, groups, or things:</D> <X>There's some sort of disagreement between them.</X><dot><X>There may be a connection between the two crimes.</X>

bicycle1 (informal bike) nouncountablea vehicle with two wheels that you sit on and ride by moving your legs: to ride a bicycleto go somewhere on your bicyclebicycle2verbto ride a bicycle: to bicycle to townto go bicycling

<H>birthday</H><audio>birthday.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>the day in each year that is the same date as the one when you were born:</D> <X>My birthday's (on) November 15.</X><dot><X>my eighteenth birthday</X><dot><X>a birthday present/card</X>

<H>black</H><su>1</su><audio>black.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><D>of the darkest color possible, the color of the night sky:</D> <X>People usually wear black clothes at funerals.</X><H>black</H><su>2</su><audio>black.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>uncountable</bracket><D>the darkest color, like the night sky:</D> <X>She likes to wear black.</X> (= black clothes)
blond (also blonde) adjective; nouncountable(a person) with light-colored or yellow hair: Most people in our family have blond hair.

<H>blue</H><su>1</su><audio>blue.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><D>having the color of a clear sky on a sunny day:</D> <X>bright blue eyes</X><dot><X>light/dark blue</X><H>blue</H><su>2</su><audio>blue.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><D>the color of a clear sky on a sunny day:</D> <bracket>countable</bracket><X>The room was decorated in vibrant blues and yellows.</X><dot><bracket>uncountable</bracket><X>dressed in blue</X> (= blue clothes)

<H>boat</H><audio>boat.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a small vehicle that is used for traveling across water:</D> <X>The island can only be reached by boat/in a boat.</X><dot><X>a fishing boat</X><dot><X>a rowboat/motorboat/sailboat</X>

<H>book</H><audio>book.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><NR>1.</NR><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a number of sheets of paper, fastened together inside a cover, with words printed on them for people to read:</D> <X>I'm reading a book on astronomy.</X><dot><X>She's writing a book about her childhood experiences.</X><dot><X>Do you have any books by Toni Morrison?</X><dot><X>Open your books, please.</X><NR>2.</NR><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a number of pieces of paper, fastened together inside a cover, for people to write on:</D> <X>an address book</X>
<H>bookstore</H><audio>bookstore.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a store that sells books</D>

<H>bored</H><audio>bored.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><D>feeling uninterested and tired because something is not exciting or because you do not have anything to do:</D> <X>I'm bored. There's nothing to do at home.</X><dot><X>The kids get bored on long car trips.</X>
<H>boring</H><audio>boring.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><D>uninteresting; dull:</D> <X>a boring movie</X><dot><X>boring work</X>
<H>boutique</H><audio>boutique.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a small store that sells expensive clothes, etc.</D>

<H>box</H><audio>box.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><NR>1.</NR><D>a square or rectangular container for solid objects. A box often has a lid:</D> <X>I opened the lid and looked inside the box.</X><NR>2.</NR><D>a box (1) and the things inside it:</D> <X>a box of candy/tissues</X><NR>3.</NR><D>an empty square or rectangle on a form in which you have to write something:</D> <X>Write your full name in the box below.</X>

breakverb(past broke; past participle broken) 1.to separate, or make something separate, into two or more pieces: She dropped the vase onto the floor and it broke.He broke his leg in a car accident.2.(used about a machine, etc.) to stop working; to stop a machine, etc. from working: My watch broke last week.Be careful with my camera! Don't break it!

<H>brother</H><audio>brother.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a man or boy who has the same parents as another person:</D> <X>Michael and Jim are brothers.</X><dot><X>Michael is Jim's brother.</X><dot><X>a younger/an older brother</X>

<H>brown</H><su>1</su><audio>brown.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><D>having the color of soil or wood:</D> <X>brown shoes</X><dot><X>dark brown hair</X><H>brown</H><su>2</su><audio>brown.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><D>the color of soil or wood:</D> <bracket>countable</bracket><X>the yellows and browns of the trees in the fall</X><dot><bracket>uncountable</bracket><X>You don't look nice in brown</X> (= in brown clothes).

<H>building</H><audio>building.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a structure, such as a house, church or school, that has a roof and walls:</D> <X>There are a lot of very old buildings in this town.</X>

busnouncountable(plural buses; also busses) a big public vehicle that takes passengers from one place to another along a fixed route: to get on/off the busWe'll have to hurry up if we want to catch the 9 o'clock bus.I ride the bus to work every day.

<H>business</H><audio>business.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>uncountable</bracket><D>buying and selling as a way of earning money:</D> <X>She's interested in a career in international business.</X><dot><X>They are very easy to do business with.</X>
<H>business school</H><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a graduate school that teaches how to analyze and manage businesses</D>

<H>but</H><audio>but.mp3</audio><PS>conjunction</PS><NR>1.</NR><D>(used for introducing an idea that contrasts with or is different from what has just been said):</D> <X>The weather will be sunny but cold.</X><dot><X>James doesn't have a car, but his sister does.</X><NR>2.</NR><D>however; and yet:</D> <X>She's been studying Italian for five years, but she doesn't speak it very well.</X><dot><X>I'd love to come, but I can't make it until 8 o'clock.</X><NR>3.</NR><D>(used with an apology):</D> <X>I'm sorry, but I can't stay any longer.</X>

<H>button</H><audio>button.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><NR>1.</NR><D>a small, often round, piece of plastic, wood, or metal that you use for fastening your clothes:</D> <X>One of the buttons on my jacket came off.</X><dot><X>a coat/shirt button</X><NR>2.</NR><D>a small part of a machine, etc. that you press in order to operate something:</D> <X>Press this button to ring the bell.</X><dot><X>Which button turns the volume down?</X><dot><X>Position the cursor where you want it and click with the left mouse button.</X>
buyverb(past, past participle bought) to get something by paying money for it: I'm going to buy a new dress for the party.We bought this book for you in New York.Can I buy you a cup of coffee?

bypreposition1.beside; very near: Come and sit by me.
We stayed at a resort by the ocean.2.using something: Will you be paying by credit card?The house is heated by electricity."How do you go to work?" "By bus, usually."
